contents.verseText: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
contents: Adam, Seth, Enosh,

contents.verseText: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
contents: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,

contents.verseText: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech.
contents: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech.

contents.verseText: The sons of Noah: Shem, Ham, and Japheth. 1
contents: The sons of Noah:

footnote.ft: Hebrew does not include The sons of; LXX Noah: the sons of Noah; see Genesis 5:32.

li1: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

contents.verseText: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras. 2
contents: The sons of Japheth:

li2: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

contents.verseText: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah. 2
contents: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath,

footnote.ft: Many Hebrew manuscripts and Vulgate (see also LXX and Genesis 10:3); most Hebrew manuscripts Diphath

contents: and Togarmah.

contents.verseText: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites. 1
contents: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites.

contents.verseText: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan. 2
contents: The sons of Ham:

li2: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

contents.verseText: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan. 2
contents: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta,

footnote.ft: Sabta is a variant of Sabtah; see Genesis 10:7.

contents: Raamah, and Sabteca.

li2: The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

contents.verseText: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who began to be a mighty one on the earth. 2
contents: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who began to be a mighty one

footnote.ft: Or who established himself as a mighty warrior

contents: on the earth.

contents.verseText: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,
contents: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,

contents.verseText: the Pathrusites, the Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites. 2
contents: the Pathrusites, the Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites.

footnote.ft: Some translators adjust the Hebrew word order to the Casluhites, and the Caphtorites (from whom the Philistines came); see also Jeremiah 47:4 and Amos 9:7.

contents.verseText: And Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
contents: And Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn,

footnote.ft: Or of the Sidonians, the foremost

contents: and of the Hittites,

footnote.ft: Hebrew and of Heth

contents.verseText: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
contents: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,

contents.verseText: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
contents: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,

contents.verseText: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. 1
contents: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.

contents.verseText: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech. 2
contents: The sons of Shem:

li2: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.
The sons of Aram:

footnote.ft: One Hebrew manuscript and some LXX manuscripts (see also Genesis 10:23); most Hebrew manuscripts do not include The sons of Aram.

contents: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.

footnote.ft: Meshech is a variant of Mash; see Genesis 10:23.

contents.verseText: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber. 2
contents: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.

contents.verseText: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided, and his brother was named Joktan. 2
contents: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg,

footnote.ft: Peleg means division.

contents: because in his days the earth was divided, and his brother was named Joktan.

contents.verseText: And Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
contents: And Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

contents.verseText: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
contents: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

contents.verseText: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
contents: Obal,

footnote.ft: LXX and Syriac (see also Genesis 10:28); Hebrew Ebal

contents: Abimael, Sheba,

contents.verseText: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan. 2
contents: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.

contents.verseText: So from Shem came Arphaxad, Shelah,
contents: So from Shem came Arphaxad, Shelah,

footnote.ft: Literally Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah; some LXX manuscripts Shem, Arphaxad, Cainan, Shelah; see also Genesis 10:24 LXX and Luke 3:35–36.

contents.verseText: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
contents: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

contents.verseText: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
contents: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

contents.verseText: and Abram (that is, Abraham).
contents: and Abram (that is, Abraham).

contents.verseText: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.
contents: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.

contents.verseText: These are their genealogies: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
contents: These are their genealogies:

li1: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

contents.verseText: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
contents: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,

contents.verseText: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael. 1
contents: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.

contents.verseText: The sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan. 1
contents: The sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine:

li2: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

li1: The sons of Jokshan:

li2: Sheba and Dedan.

contents.verseText: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All of these were Keturah’s sons. 1
contents: The sons of Midian:

li2: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah.
All of these were Keturah’s sons.

contents.verseText: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel. 1
contents: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac:

li2: Esau and Israel.

contents.verseText: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. 2
contents: The sons of Esau:

li2: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

contents.verseText: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz; and by Timna, Amalek. 2
contents: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho,

footnote.ft: Many Hebrew manuscripts, some LXX manuscripts, and Syriac (see also Genesis 36:11); most Hebrew manuscripts Zephi

contents: Gatam, and Kenaz; and by Timna, Amalek.

contents.verseText: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. 1
contents: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

contents.verseText: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. 2
contents: The sons of Seir:

li2: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

contents.verseText: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister. 2
contents: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam.

footnote.ft: Homam is a variant of Hemam; see Genesis 36:22.

contents: Timna was Lotan’s sister.

contents.verseText: The sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah. 2
contents: The sons of Shobal: Alvan,

footnote.ft: LXX (see also Genesis 36:23); Hebrew Alian

contents: Manahath, Ebal, Shepho,

footnote.ft: LXX (see also Genesis 36:23); Hebrew Shephi

contents: and Onam.

li2: The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.

contents.verseText: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran. 2
contents: The son

footnote.ft: Hebrew sons

contents: of Anah: Dishon.

li2: The sons of Dishon: Hemdan,

footnote.ft: LXX (see also Genesis 36:26); Hebrew Hamran

contents: Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

contents.verseText: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
contents: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.

footnote.ft: LXX (see also Genesis 36:27); Hebrew Jaakan

li2: The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.

contents.verseText: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites: Bela son of Beor. His city was named Dinhabah. 1
contents: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites:

footnote.ft: Or before an Israelite king ruled over them

li1: Bela son of Beor. His city was named Dinhabah.

contents.verseText: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place. 1
contents: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place.

contents.verseText: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place. 1
contents: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

contents.verseText: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Avith. 1
contents: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Avith.

contents.verseText: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place. 1
contents: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.

contents.verseText: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates reigned in his place. 1
contents: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates

footnote.ft: Hebrew the River

contents: reigned in his place.

contents.verseText: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place. 1
contents: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place.

contents.verseText: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab. 1
contents: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place. His city was named Pau,

footnote.ft: Many MT manuscripts, some LXX manuscripts, Vulgate, and Syriac (see also Genesis 36:39); most MT manuscripts Pai

contents: and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.

contents.verseText: Then Hadad died. Now the chiefs of Edom were Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
contents: Then Hadad died.
Now the chiefs of Edom were Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

contents.verseText: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
contents: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,

contents.verseText: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
contents: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

contents.verseText: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
contents: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.

contents.verseText: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
contents: These were the sons of Israel:

li1: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

contents.verseText: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher. 1
contents: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

contents.verseText: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him by Bath-shua the Canaanite. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD, who put him to death. 2
contents: The sons of Judah:

li2: Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him by Bath-shua the Canaanite. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD, who put him to death.

contents.verseText: Tamar, Judah’s daughter-in-law, bore to him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all. 1
contents: Tamar, Judah’s daughter-in-law, bore to him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.

contents.verseText: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul. 1
contents: The sons of Perez:

li2: Hezron and Hamul.

contents.verseText: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five in all. 1
contents: The sons of Zerah:

li2: Zimri,

footnote.ft: Zimri is a variant of Zabdi; see Joshua 7:1.

contents: Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara

footnote.ft: Most Hebrew manuscripts; many Hebrew manuscripts, some LXX manuscripts, and Syriac (see also 1 Kings 4:31) Darda

contents: —five in all.

contents.verseText: The son of Carmi: Achar, who brought trouble upon Israel by violating the ban on devoted things. 1
contents: The son

footnote.ft: Hebrew sons

contents: of Carmi:

li2: Achar,

footnote.ft: Achar means troubler; also called Achan in Joshua 7 and Joshua 22.

contents: who brought trouble upon Israel by violating the ban on devoted things.

contents.verseText: The son of Ethan: Azariah. 1
contents: The son of Ethan:

li2: Azariah.

contents.verseText: The sons who were born to Hezron: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb. 1
contents: The sons who were born to Hezron:

li2: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb.

footnote.ft: Hebrew Chelubai, a variant of Caleb; see verse 18.

contents.verseText: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, a leader of the descendants of Judah. 1
contents: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, a leader of the descendants of Judah.

contents.verseText: Nahshon was the father of Salmon, and Salmon was the father of Boaz. 1
contents: Nahshon was the father of Salmon,

footnote.ft: LXX (see also Ruth 4:20–21); Hebrew Salma; twice in this verse

contents: and Salmon was the father of Boaz.

contents.verseText: Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse. 1
contents: Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse.

contents.verseText: Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; Abinadab was born second, Shimea third,
contents: Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; Abinadab was born second, Shimea

footnote.ft: Shimea is a variant of Shammah, Shimeah, and Shimei; see 1 Samuel 16:9, 2 Samuel 13:3, and 2 Samuel 21:21.

contents: third,

contents.verseText: Nethanel fourth, Raddai fifth,
contents: Nethanel fourth, Raddai fifth,

contents.verseText: Ozem sixth, and David seventh.
contents: Ozem sixth, and David seventh.

contents.verseText: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the three sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.
contents: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the three sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.

contents.verseText: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite. 1
contents: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether

footnote.ft: Jether is a variant of Ithra; see 2 Samuel 17:25.

contents: the Ishmaelite.

contents.verseText: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth. These were the sons of Azubah: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
contents: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth. These were the sons of Azubah: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

contents.verseText: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore to him Hur.
contents: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath,

footnote.ft: Ephrath is a variant of Ephrathah; see verse 50.

contents: who bore to him Hur.

contents.verseText: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri was the father of Bezalel. 1
contents: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri was the father of Bezalel.

contents.verseText: Later, Hezron slept with the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead. He had married her when he was sixty years old, and she bore to him Segub.
contents: Later, Hezron slept with the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead. He had married her when he was sixty years old, and she bore to him Segub.

contents.verseText: Segub was the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
contents: Segub was the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

contents.verseText: But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth-jair, along with Kenath and its sixty surrounding villages. All these were descendants of Machir the father of Gilead. 1
contents: But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth-jair,

footnote.ft: Or the villages of Jair

contents: along with Kenath and its sixty surrounding villages. All these were descendants of Machir the father of Gilead.

contents.verseText: After Hezron died in Caleb-ephrathah, his wife Abijah bore to him Ashhur the father of Tekoa. 1
contents: After Hezron died in Caleb-ephrathah, his wife Abijah bore

footnote.ft: Or After Hezron died, Caleb had relations with Ephrathah, the wife of Hezron his father, and she bore; see also LXX.

contents: to him Ashhur the father

footnote.ft: Or the founder; also in verses 42, 45, 49, and possibly elsewhere

contents: of Tekoa.

contents.verseText: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
contents: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron:

li2: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.

contents.verseText: Jerahmeel had another wife named Atarah, who was the mother of Onam. 1
contents: Jerahmeel had another wife named Atarah, who was the mother of Onam.

contents.verseText: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker. 1
contents: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel:

li2: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.

contents.verseText: The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
contents: The sons of Onam:

li2: Shammai and Jada.

li1: The sons of Shammai:

li2: Nadab and Abishur.

contents.verseText: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, and she bore to him Ahban and Molid. 1
contents: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, and she bore to him Ahban and Molid.

contents.verseText: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children. 1
contents: The sons of Nadab:

li2: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.

contents.verseText: The son of Appaim: Ishi. The son of Ishi: Sheshan. The son of Sheshan: Ahlai. 1
contents: The son

footnote.ft: Hebrew sons; three times in this verse

contents: of Appaim:

li2: Ishi.

li1: The son of Ishi:

li2: Sheshan.

li1: The son of Sheshan:

li2: Ahlai.

contents.verseText: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children. 1
contents: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai:

li2: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.

contents.verseText: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel. 1
contents: The sons of Jonathan:

li2: Peleth and Zaza.

li1: These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.

contents.verseText: Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters; but he did have an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
contents: Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters; but he did have an Egyptian servant named Jarha.

contents.verseText: Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore to him Attai. 1
contents: Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore to him Attai.

contents.verseText: Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan was the father of Zabad,
contents: Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan was the father of Zabad,

contents.verseText: Zabad was the father of Ephlal, Ephlal was the father of Obed,
contents: Zabad was the father of Ephlal, Ephlal was the father of Obed,

contents.verseText: Obed was the father of Jehu, Jehu was the father of Azariah,
contents: Obed was the father of Jehu, Jehu was the father of Azariah,

contents.verseText: Azariah was the father of Helez, Helez was the father of Elasah,
contents: Azariah was the father of Helez, Helez was the father of Elasah,

contents.verseText: Elasah was the father of Sismai, Sismai was the father of Shallum,
contents: Elasah was the father of Sismai, Sismai was the father of Shallum,

contents.verseText: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama. 1
contents: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.

contents.verseText: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and Mareshah his second son, who was the father of Hebron. 1
contents: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel:

li2: Mesha

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX Mareshah

contents: his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and Mareshah his second son, who was the father of Hebron.

contents.verseText: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
contents: The sons of Hebron:

li2: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.

contents.verseText: Shema was the father of Raham the father of Jorkeam, and Rekem was the father of Shammai.
contents: Shema was the father of Raham the father of Jorkeam, and Rekem was the father of Shammai.

contents.verseText: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth-zur. 1
contents: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.

contents.verseText: Caleb’s concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez. 1
contents: Caleb’s concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.

contents.verseText: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph. 1
contents: The sons of Jahdai:

li2: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.

contents.verseText: Caleb’s concubine Maacah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.
contents: Caleb’s concubine Maacah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.

contents.verseText: She was also the mother of Shaaph father of Madmannah, and of Sheva father of Machbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Acsah.
contents: She was also the mother of Shaaph father of Madmannah, and of Sheva father of Machbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Acsah.

contents.verseText: These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,
contents: These were the descendants of Caleb.

li1: The sons

footnote.ft: LXX and Vulgate; Hebrew son

contents: of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah:

footnote.ft: Ephrathah is a variant of Ephrath; see verse 19.

li2: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,

contents.verseText: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth-gader. 1
contents: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth-gader.

contents.verseText: These were the descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,
contents: These were the descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim:

li2: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,

contents.verseText: and the clans of Kiriath-jearim—the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites. 1
contents: and the clans of Kiriath-jearim—the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.

contents.verseText: The descendants of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,
contents: The descendants of Salma:

li2: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,

contents.verseText: and the clans of the scribes who lived at Jabez—the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
contents: and the clans of the scribes

footnote.ft: Or of the Sopherites

contents: who lived at Jabez—the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.

footnote.ft: Or the father of Beth-Rekab or the founder of the house of Rechab

contents.verseText: These were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: The firstborn was Amnon by Ahinoam of Jezreel; the second was Daniel by Abigail of Carmel; 1
contents: These were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron:

li1: The firstborn was Amnon by Ahinoam of Jezreel;
the second was Daniel by Abigail of Carmel;

contents.verseText: the third was Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur; the fourth was Adonijah the son of Haggith; 1
contents: the third was Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur;

li1: the fourth was Adonijah the son of Haggith;

contents.verseText: the fifth was Shephatiah by Abital; and the sixth was Ithream by his wife Eglah. 1
contents: the fifth was Shephatiah by Abital;

li1: and the sixth was Ithream by his wife Eglah.

contents: These men listed by name were the leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly,

contents.verseText: and they journeyed to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, in search of pasture for their flocks.
contents: and they journeyed to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, in search of pasture for their flocks.

contents.verseText: There they found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful, and quiet; for some Hamites had lived there formerly. 1
contents: There they found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful, and quiet; for some Hamites had lived there formerly.

contents.verseText: These who were noted by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites and Meunites there in their dwellings, devoting them to destruction even to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.
contents: These who were noted by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites and Meunites there in their dwellings, devoting them to destruction

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons to the LORD, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering.

contents: even to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.

contents.verseText: And five hundred of these Simeonites led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, went to Mount Seir
contents: And five hundred of these Simeonites led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, went to Mount Seir

contents.verseText: and struck down the remnant of the Amalekites who had escaped. And they have lived there to this day.
contents: and struck down the remnant of the Amalekites who had escaped. And they have lived there to this day.

contents.verseText: These were the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel. Though he was the firstborn, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel, because Reuben defiled his father’s bed. So he is not reckoned according to birthright.
contents: These were the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel. Though he was the firstborn, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel, because Reuben defiled his father’s bed. So he is not reckoned according to birthright.

contents.verseText: And though Judah prevailed over his brothers and a ruler came from him, the birthright belonged to Joseph.
contents: And though Judah prevailed over his brothers and a ruler came from him, the birthright belonged to Joseph.

contents: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel:
Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

li1: Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.

li2: Jeiel the chief, Zechariah,

contents.verseText: They also settled in the east as far as the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in the land of Gilead. 2
contents: They also settled in the east as far as the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in the land of Gilead.

contents.verseText: During the days of Saul they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands, and they occupied the homes of the Hagrites throughout the region east of Gilead.
contents: During the days of Saul they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands, and they occupied the homes of the Hagrites throughout the region east of Gilead.

contents.verseText: The descendants of Gad lived next to the Reubenites in the land of Bashan, as far as Salecah: 1
contents: The descendants of Gad lived next to the Reubenites in the land of Bashan, as far as Salecah:

contents.verseText: Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Jaanai and Shaphat, who lived in Bashan. 1
contents: Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Jaanai and Shaphat, who lived in Bashan.

contents.verseText: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
contents: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.

contents.verseText: Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family. 1
contents: Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family.

contents: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its towns, and throughout the pasturelands of Sharon.

contents.verseText: All of them were reckoned in the genealogies during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel. 1
contents: All of them were reckoned in the genealogies during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.

contents.verseText: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 warriors—valiant men who carried the shield and sword, drew the bow, and were trained for battle.
contents: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 warriors—valiant men who carried the shield and sword, drew the bow, and were trained for battle.

contents.verseText: They waged war against the Hagrites, as well as Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab. 1
contents: They waged war against the Hagrites, as well as Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.

contents.verseText: And because they cried out to God in battle, they were helped against their enemies, and the Hagrites and all their allies were delivered into their hands. Because they put their trust in God, He answered their prayers.
contents: And because they cried out to God in battle, they were helped against their enemies, and the Hagrites and all their allies were delivered into their hands. Because they put their trust in God, He answered their prayers.

contents.verseText: They seized the livestock of the Hagrites—50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, and 2,000 donkeys. They also took 100,000 captives,
contents: They seized the livestock of the Hagrites—50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, and 2,000 donkeys. They also took 100,000 captives,

contents.verseText: and many others fell slain, because the battle belonged to God. And they occupied the land until the exile.
contents: and many others fell slain, because the battle belonged to God. And they occupied the land until the exile.

contents.verseText: Now the people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous. They settled in the land from Bashan to Baal-hermon (that is, Senir, also known as Mount Hermon).
contents: Now the people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous. They settled in the land from Bashan to Baal-hermon (that is, Senir, also known as Mount Hermon).

footnote.ft: Literally from Bashan to Baal-hermon and Senir and Mount Hermon.

contents.verseText: These were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were mighty men of valor, famous men, and heads of their families.
contents: These were the heads of their families:

li1: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel.
They were mighty men of valor, famous men, and heads of their families.

contents.verseText: But they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers, and they prostituted themselves with the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them. 1
contents: But they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers, and they prostituted themselves with the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.

contents.verseText: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria) to take the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. And he brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river of Gozan, where they remain to this day.
contents: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria) to take the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. And he brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river of Gozan, where they remain to this day.

contents.verseText: These were the gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their relatives. Shallum was their chief;
contents: These were the gatekeepers:

li2: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their relatives.
Shallum was their chief;

contents.verseText: he was previously stationed at the King’s Gate on the east side. These were the gatekeepers from the camp of the Levites.
contents: he was previously stationed at the King’s Gate on the east side. These were the gatekeepers from the camp of the Levites.

contents.verseText: Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his relatives from the Korahites were assigned to guard the thresholds of the Tent, just as their fathers had been assigned to guard the entrance to the dwelling of the LORD. 2
contents: Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph,

footnote.ft: Ebiasaph is a variant of Abiasaph; see Exodus 6:24.

contents: the son of Korah, and his relatives from the Korahites were assigned to guard the thresholds of the Tent, just as their fathers had been assigned to guard the entrance to the dwelling of the LORD.

contents.verseText: In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar had been in charge of the gatekeepers, and the LORD was with him. 2
contents: In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar had been in charge of the gatekeepers, and the LORD was with him.

contents.verseText: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. 2
contents: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

contents.verseText: The number of those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds was 212. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. David and Samuel the seer had appointed them to their positions of trust.
contents: The number of those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds was 212. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. David and Samuel the seer had appointed them to their positions of trust.

contents.verseText: So they and their descendants were assigned to guard the gates of the house of the LORD—the house called the Tent.
contents: So they and their descendants were assigned to guard the gates of the house of the LORD—the house called the Tent.

contents.verseText: The gatekeepers were stationed on the four sides: east, west, north, and south.
contents: The gatekeepers were stationed on the four sides: east, west, north, and south.

contents.verseText: Their relatives came from their villages at fixed times to serve with them for seven-day periods.
contents: Their relatives came from their villages at fixed times to serve with them for seven-day periods.

contents.verseText: But the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the rooms and the treasuries of the house of God.
contents: But the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the rooms and the treasuries of the house of God.

contents.verseText: They would spend the night stationed around the house of God, because they were responsible for guarding it and opening it every morning.
contents: They would spend the night stationed around the house of God, because they were responsible for guarding it and opening it every morning.

contents.verseText: Some of them were in charge of the articles used in worship, to count them whenever they were brought in or taken out.
contents: Some of them were in charge of the articles used in worship, to count them whenever they were brought in or taken out.

contents.verseText: Others were put in charge of the furnishings and other articles of the sanctuary, as well as the fine flour, wine, oil, frankincense, and spices.
contents: Others were put in charge of the furnishings and other articles of the sanctuary, as well as the fine flour, wine, oil, frankincense, and spices.

contents.verseText: And some of the sons of the priests mixed the spices.
contents: And some of the sons of the priests mixed the spices.

contents.verseText: A Levite named Mattithiah, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with baking the bread.
contents: A Levite named Mattithiah, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with baking the bread.

contents.verseText: Some of their Kohathite brothers were responsible for preparing the rows of the showbread every Sabbath.
contents: Some of their Kohathite brothers were responsible for preparing the rows of the showbread every Sabbath.

contents.verseText: Those who were musicians, the heads of Levite families, stayed in the temple chambers and were exempt from other duties because they were on duty day and night.
contents: Those who were musicians, the heads of Levite families, stayed in the temple chambers and were exempt from other duties because they were on duty day and night.

contents.verseText: All these were heads of Levite families, chiefs according to their genealogies, and they lived in Jerusalem. 1
contents: All these were heads of Levite families, chiefs according to their genealogies, and they lived in Jerusalem.

contents: Jeiel the father

footnote.ft: Or the founder

contents: of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maacah.

contents: Abdon was his firstborn son, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

contents: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.

contents: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam.

footnote.ft: Shimeam is a variant of Shimeah; see 1 Chronicles 8:32.

contents: They too lived alongside their relatives in Jerusalem.

contents: Ner was the father of Kish, Kish was the father of Saul, and Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.

contents: The son of Jonathan:

li2: Merib-baal, who was the father of Micah.

contents: The sons of Micah:

li2: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

contents: Ahaz was the father of Jarah; Jarah

contents: was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri was the father of Moza.

contents: Moza was the father of Binea. Rephaiah

contents: was his son, Elasah his son, and Azel his son.

contents.verseText: And Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
contents: And Azel had six sons, and these were their names:

li2: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.

contents.verseText: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled before them, and many fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
contents: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled before them, and many fell slain on Mount Gilboa.

contents.verseText: The Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons, and they killed Saul’s sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua.
contents: The Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons, and they killed Saul’s sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua.

contents.verseText: When the battle intensified against Saul, the archers overtook him and wounded him.
contents: When the battle intensified against Saul, the archers overtook him and wounded him.

contents.verseText: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and run it through me, or these uncircumcised men will come and torture me!” But his armor-bearer was terrified and refused to do it. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
contents: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and run it through me, or these uncircumcised men will come and torture me!”
But his armor-bearer was terrified and refused to do it. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.

contents.verseText: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his own sword and died.
contents: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his own sword and died.

contents.verseText: So Saul died together with his three sons and all his house.
contents: So Saul died together with his three sons and all his house.

contents.verseText: When all the Israelites in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their cities and ran away. So the Philistines came and occupied their cities.
contents: When all the Israelites in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their cities and ran away. So the Philistines came and occupied their cities.

contents.verseText: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
contents: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.

contents.verseText: They stripped Saul, cut off his head, took his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news in the temple of their idols and among their people.
contents: They stripped Saul, cut off his head, took his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news in the temple of their idols and among their people.

contents.verseText: They put his armor in the temple of their gods and hung his head in the temple of Dagon.
contents: They put his armor in the temple of their gods and hung his head in the temple of Dagon.

contents.verseText: When the people of Jabesh-gilead heard about everything the Philistines had done to Saul,
contents: When the people of Jabesh-gilead heard about everything the Philistines had done to Saul,

contents.verseText: all their men of valor set out and retrieved the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. And they buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh and fasted seven days.
contents: all their men of valor set out and retrieved the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. And they buried their bones under the oak

footnote.ft: Or terebinth or great tree

contents: in Jabesh and fasted seven days.

contents.verseText: So Saul died for his unfaithfulness to the LORD, because he did not keep the word of the LORD and even consulted a medium for guidance,
contents: So Saul died for his unfaithfulness to the LORD, because he did not keep the word of the LORD and even consulted a medium for guidance,

contents.verseText: and he failed to inquire of the LORD. So the LORD put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.
contents: and he failed to inquire of the LORD. So the LORD put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.

s1: David Anointed King of All Israel

contents.verseText: Then all Israel came together to David at Hebron and said, “Here we are, your own flesh and blood.
contents: Then all Israel came together to David at Hebron and said, “Here we are, your own flesh and blood.

contents.verseText: Even in times past, while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel out and brought them back. And the LORD your God said, ‘You will shepherd My people Israel, and you will be ruler over them.’”
contents: Even in times past,

footnote.ft: Or For some time

contents: while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel out and brought them back. And the LORD your God said, ‘You will shepherd My people Israel, and you will be ruler over them.’”

contents.verseText: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, where David made a covenant with them before the LORD. And they anointed him king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD through Samuel.
contents: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, where David made a covenant with them before the LORD. And they anointed him king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD through Samuel.

contents.verseText: Then David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus), where the Jebusites inhabited the land.
contents: Then David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus), where the Jebusites inhabited the land.

contents.verseText: The people of Jebus said to David, “You will never get in here.” Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion (that is, the City of David).
contents: The people of Jebus said to David, “You will never get in here.”
Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion (that is, the City of David).

contents.verseText: Now David had said, “Whoever is the first to strike down a Jebusite will become chief commander.” And Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, and he became the chief.
contents: Now David had said, “Whoever is the first to strike down a Jebusite will become chief commander.”
And Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, and he became the chief.

contents.verseText: So David took up residence in the fortress; that is why it was called the City of David.
contents: So David took up residence in the fortress; that is why it was called the City of David.

contents.verseText: He built up the city around it, from the supporting terraces to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.
contents: He built up the city around it, from the supporting terraces

footnote.ft: Hebrew the Millo

contents: to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.

contents.verseText: And David became greater and greater, for the LORD of Hosts was with him.
contents: And David became greater and greater, for the LORD of Hosts was with him.

contents.verseText: Now these were the chiefs of David’s mighty men, who, together with all Israel, bolstered and strengthened his kingdom, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
contents: Now these were the chiefs of David’s mighty men, who, together with all Israel, bolstered and strengthened his kingdom, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.

contents.verseText: This is the list of David’s mighty men: Jashobeam son of Hachmoni was chief of the officers; he wielded his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed at one time.
contents: This is the list of David’s mighty men:
Jashobeam son of Hachmoni was chief of the officers;

footnote.ft: Or of the Thirty; some LXX manuscripts of the Three; see 2 Samuel 23:8.

contents: he wielded his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed at one time.

contents.verseText: Next in command was Eleazar son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men.
contents: Next in command was Eleazar son of Dodo

footnote.ft: Dodo is a variant of Dodai; see 1 Chronicles 27:4.

contents: the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men.

contents.verseText: He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At the place with a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines.
contents: He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At the place with a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines.

contents.verseText: But Eleazar and David stationed themselves in the middle of the field and defended it. They struck down the Philistines, and the LORD brought about a great victory.
contents: But Eleazar and David stationed themselves

footnote.ft: Literally But they stationed themselves

contents: in the middle of the field and defended it. They struck down the Philistines, and the LORD brought about a great victory.

contents.verseText: Three of the thirty chief men went down to David, to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a company of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
contents: Three of the thirty chief men went down to David, to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a company of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.

contents.verseText: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was at Bethlehem.
contents: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was at Bethlehem.

contents.verseText: David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!”
contents: David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!”

contents.verseText: So the Three broke through the Philistine camp, drew water from the well at the gate of Bethlehem, and brought it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out to the LORD,
contents: So the Three broke through the Philistine camp, drew water from the well at the gate of Bethlehem, and brought it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out to the LORD,

contents.verseText: saying, “Far be it from me, my God, to do this! How can I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?” Because they had brought it at the risk of their lives, David refused to drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.
contents: saying, “Far be it from me, my God, to do this! How can I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?” Because they had brought it at the risk of their lives, David refused to drink it.
Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.

contents.verseText: Now Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the Three, and he lifted his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and won a name along with the Three.
contents: Now Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the Three,

footnote.ft: Hebrew; Syriac the Thirty; also in verse 21

contents: and he lifted his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and won a name along with the Three.

contents.verseText: He was doubly honored above the Three, and he became their commander, even though he was not included among the Three.
contents: He was doubly honored above the Three, and he became their commander, even though he was not included among the Three.

contents.verseText: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a man of valor from Kabzeel, a man of many exploits. He struck down two champions of Moab, and on a snowy day he went down into a pit and killed a lion.
contents: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a man of valor from Kabzeel, a man of many exploits. He struck down two champions of Moab,

footnote.ft: Or two sons of Ariel of Moab

contents: and on a snowy day he went down into a pit and killed a lion.

contents.verseText: He also killed an Egyptian, a huge man five cubits tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver’s beam in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club, snatched the spear from his hand, and killed the Egyptian with his own spear.
contents: He also killed an Egyptian, a huge man five cubits tall.

footnote.ft: 5 cubits is approximately 7 feet 6 inches or 229 centimeters tall.

contents: Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver’s beam in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club, snatched the spear from his hand, and killed the Egyptian with his own spear.

contents.verseText: These were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who won a name alongside the three mighty men.
contents: These were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who won a name alongside the three mighty men.

contents.verseText: He was most honored among the Thirty, but he did not become one of the Three. And David appointed him over his guard.
contents: He was most honored among the Thirty, but he did not become one of the Three. And David appointed him over his guard.

Elhanan son of Dodo of Bethlehem,

contents: Jediael son of Shimri and his brother Joha the Tizite,

contents: Eliel the Mahavite,

Ithmah the Moabite,

contents.verseText: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
contents: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.

s1: The Mighty Men Join David at Ziklag

contents.verseText: Now these were the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was still banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish (they were among the mighty men who helped him in battle;
contents: Now these were the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was still banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish (they were among the mighty men who helped him in battle;

contents.verseText: they were archers using both the right and left hands to sling stones and shoot arrows; and they were Saul’s kinsmen from Benjamin): 1
contents: they were archers using both the right and left hands to sling stones and shoot arrows; and they were Saul’s kinsmen from Benjamin):

contents.verseText: Ahiezer their chief and Joash, who were the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; Beracah; Jehu the Anathothite; 1
contents: Ahiezer their chief and Joash, who were the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite;

li1: Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth;
Beracah;
Jehu the Anathothite;

contents.verseText: Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the Thirty and a leader over the Thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite; 1
contents: Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the Thirty and a leader over the Thirty;

li1: Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite;

contents.verseText: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite; 1
contents: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite;

contents.verseText: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, who were Korahites; 1
contents: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, who were Korahites;

contents.verseText: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.
contents: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.

contents.verseText: Some Gadites defected to David at his stronghold in the desert. They were mighty men of valor, trained for battle, experts with the shield and spear, whose faces were like the faces of lions and who were as swift as gazelles on the mountains: 1
contents: Some Gadites defected to David at his stronghold in the desert. They were mighty men of valor, trained for battle, experts with the shield and spear, whose faces were like the faces of lions and who were as swift as gazelles on the mountains:

contents.verseText: Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,
contents: Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,

contents.verseText: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
contents: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,

contents.verseText: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
contents: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,

contents.verseText: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
contents: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,

contents.verseText: Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbanai the eleventh.
contents: Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbanai the eleventh.

contents.verseText: These Gadites were army commanders, the least of whom was a match for a hundred, and the greatest for a thousand.
contents: These Gadites were army commanders, the least of whom was a match for a hundred, and the greatest for a thousand.

contents.verseText: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks, and they put to flight all those in the valleys, both to the east and to the west.
contents: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks, and they put to flight all those in the valleys, both to the east and to the west.

contents.verseText: Other Benjamites and some men from Judah also came to David in his stronghold.
contents: Other Benjamites and some men from Judah also came to David in his stronghold.

contents.verseText: And David went out to meet them, saying, “If you have come to me in peace to help me, my heart will be united with you; but if you have come to betray me to my enemies when my hands are free of violence, may the God of our fathers see it and judge you.”
contents: And David went out to meet them, saying, “If you have come to me in peace to help me, my heart will be united with you; but if you have come to betray me to my enemies when my hands are free of violence, may the God of our fathers see it and judge you.”

contents.verseText: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, the chief of the Thirty, and he said: “We are yours, O David! We are with you, O son of Jesse! Peace, peace to you, and peace to your helpers, for your God helps you.” So David received them and made them leaders of his troops.
contents: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, the chief of the Thirty, and he said:
“We are yours, O David!
We are with you, O son of Jesse!
Peace, peace to you,
and peace to your helpers,
for your God helps you.”
So David received them and made them leaders of his troops.

contents.verseText: Some from Manasseh defected to David when he went with the Philistines to fight against Saul. (They did not help the Philistines because the Philistine rulers consulted and sent David away, saying, “It will cost us our heads if he defects to his master Saul.”)
contents: Some from Manasseh defected to David when he went with the Philistines to fight against Saul. (They did not help the Philistines because the Philistine rulers consulted and sent David away, saying, “It will cost us our heads if he defects to his master Saul.”)

contents.verseText: When David went to Ziklag, these men of Manasseh defected to him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of thousands in Manasseh.
contents: When David went to Ziklag, these men of Manasseh defected to him:

li1: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of thousands in Manasseh.

contents.verseText: They helped David against the raiders, for they were all mighty men of valor and commanders in the army.
contents: They helped David against the raiders, for they were all mighty men of valor and commanders in the army.

contents.verseText: For at that time men came to David day after day to help him, until he had a great army, like the army of God.
contents: For at that time men came to David day after day to help him, until he had a great army, like the army of God.

contents.verseText: Now these are the numbers of men armed for battle who came to David at Hebron to turn Saul’s kingdom over to him, in accordance with the word of the LORD:
contents: Now these are the numbers of men armed for battle who came to David at Hebron to turn Saul’s kingdom over to him, in accordance with the word of the LORD:

contents.verseText: From Judah: 6,800 armed troops bearing shields and spears.
contents: From Judah: 6,800 armed troops bearing shields and spears.

contents.verseText: From Simeon: 7,100 mighty men of valor, ready for battle.
contents: From Simeon: 7,100 mighty men of valor, ready for battle.

contents.verseText: From Levi: 4,600,
contents: From Levi: 4,600,

contents.verseText: including Jehoiada, leader of the house of Aaron, with 3,700 men,
contents: including Jehoiada, leader of the house of Aaron, with 3,700 men,

contents.verseText: and Zadok, a mighty young man of valor, with 22 commanders from his own family.
contents: and Zadok, a mighty young man of valor, with 22 commanders from his own family.

contents.verseText: From Benjamin, the kinsmen of Saul: 3,000, most of whom had remained loyal to the house of Saul up to that time.
contents: From Benjamin, the kinsmen of Saul: 3,000, most of whom had remained loyal to the house of Saul up to that time.

contents.verseText: From Ephraim: 20,800 mighty men of valor, famous among their own clans.
contents: From Ephraim: 20,800 mighty men of valor, famous among their own clans.

contents.verseText: From the half-tribe of Manasseh: 18,000 designated by name to come and make David king.
contents: From the half-tribe of Manasseh:

footnote.ft: That is, the half-tribe of Manasseh west of the Jordan

contents: 18,000 designated by name to come and make David king.

contents.verseText: From Issachar, men who understood the times and knew what Israel should do: 200 chiefs with all their kinsmen at their command.
contents: From Issachar, men who understood the times and knew what Israel should do: 200 chiefs with all their kinsmen at their command.

contents.verseText: From Zebulun: 50,000 fit for service, trained for battle with all kinds of weapons of war, who with one purpose were devoted to David.
contents: From Zebulun: 50,000 fit for service, trained for battle with all kinds of weapons of war, who with one purpose were devoted to David.

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew does not include to David.

contents.verseText: From Naphtali: 1,000 commanders, accompanied by 37,000 men with shield and spear.
contents: From Naphtali: 1,000 commanders, accompanied by 37,000 men with shield and spear.

contents.verseText: From Dan: 28,600 prepared for battle.
contents: From Dan: 28,600 prepared for battle.

contents.verseText: From Asher: 40,000 fit for service, prepared for battle.
contents: From Asher: 40,000 fit for service, prepared for battle.

contents.verseText: And from east of the Jordan, from Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh there: 120,000 armed with every kind of weapon of war.
contents: And from east of the Jordan, from Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh there: 120,000 armed with every kind of weapon of war.

contents.verseText: All these men of war, arrayed for battle, came to Hebron fully determined to make David king over all Israel. And all the rest of the Israelites were of one mind to make David king.
contents: All these men of war, arrayed for battle, came to Hebron fully determined to make David king over all Israel. And all the rest of the Israelites were of one mind to make David king.

contents.verseText: They spent three days there eating and drinking with David, for their relatives had provided for them.
contents: They spent three days there eating and drinking with David, for their relatives had provided for them.

contents.verseText: And their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen—abundant supplies of flour, fig cakes and raisin cakes, wine and oil, oxen and sheep. Indeed, there was joy in Israel.
contents: And their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen—abundant supplies of flour, fig cakes and raisin cakes, wine and oil, oxen and sheep. Indeed, there was joy in Israel.

contents.verseText: Then David conferred with all his leaders, the commanders of hundreds and of thousands.
contents: Then David conferred with all his leaders, the commanders of hundreds and of thousands.

contents.verseText: And he said to the whole assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if this is of the LORD our God, let us send word far and wide to the rest of our brothers in all the land of Israel, and also to the priests and Levites in their cities and pasturelands, so that they may join us.
contents: And he said to the whole assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if this is of the LORD our God, let us send word far and wide to the rest of our brothers in all the land of Israel, and also to the priests and Levites in their cities and pasturelands, so that they may join us.

contents.verseText: Then let us bring back the ark of our God, for we did not inquire of Him in the days of Saul.”
contents: Then let us bring back the ark of our God, for we did not inquire of Him

footnote.ft: Or of it

contents: in the days of Saul.”

contents.verseText: And because this proposal seemed right to all the people, the whole assembly agreed to it.
contents: And because this proposal seemed right to all the people, the whole assembly agreed to it.

contents.verseText: So David assembled all Israel, from the River Shihor in Egypt to Lebo-hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
contents: So David assembled all Israel, from the River Shihor

footnote.ft: Hebrew from the Shihor

contents: in Egypt to Lebo-hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.

contents.verseText: David and all Israel went up to Baalah of Judah (that is, Kiriath-jearim) to bring up from there the ark of God the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubim—the ark that is called by the Name.
contents: David and all Israel went up to Baalah of Judah (that is, Kiriath-jearim) to bring up from there the ark of God the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubim—the ark that is called by the Name.

footnote.ft: Or the ark of God, which is called by the Name of the LORD who is enthroned between the cherubim; or the ark of God, the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubim, where His Name is called

contents.verseText: So they carried the ark of God from the house of Abinadab on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding the cart.
contents: So they carried the ark of God from the house of Abinadab on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding the cart.

contents.verseText: David and all the Israelites were celebrating before God with all their might, with songs and on harps and lyres, with tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.
contents: David and all the Israelites were celebrating before God with all their might, with songs and on harps and lyres, with tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.

contents.verseText: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzzah reached out and took hold of the ark, because the oxen had stumbled.
contents: When they came to the threshing floor of Chidon,

footnote.ft: Chidon is a variant of Nacon; see 2 Samuel 6:6.

contents: Uzzah reached out and took hold of the ark, because the oxen had stumbled.

contents.verseText: And the anger of the LORD burned against Uzzah, and He struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark. So he died there before God.
contents: And the anger of the LORD burned against Uzzah, and He struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark. So he died there before God.

contents.verseText: Then David became angry because the LORD had burst forth against Uzzah; so he named that place Perez-uzzah, as it is called to this day.
contents: Then David became angry because the LORD had burst forth against Uzzah; so he named that place Perez-uzzah,

footnote.ft: Perez-uzzah means outbreak against Uzzah.

contents: as it is called to this day.

contents.verseText: That day David feared God and asked, “How can I ever bring the ark of God to me?”
contents: That day David feared God and asked, “How can I ever bring the ark of God to me?”

contents.verseText: So he did not move the ark with him to the City of David; instead, he took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
contents: So he did not move the ark with him to the City of David; instead, he took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

contents.verseText: Thus the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house for three months, and the LORD blessed his household and everything he owned.
contents: Thus the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house for three months, and the LORD blessed his household and everything he owned.

contents.verseText: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent envoys to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters, to build a palace for him.
contents: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent envoys to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters, to build a palace for him.

contents.verseText: And David realized that the LORD had established him as king over Israel and had highly exalted his kingdom for the sake of His people Israel.
contents: And David realized that the LORD had established him as king over Israel and had highly exalted his kingdom for the sake of His people Israel.

contents.verseText: And David took more wives in Jerusalem and became the father of more sons and daughters.
contents: And David took more wives in Jerusalem and became the father of more sons and daughters.

contents.verseText: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
contents: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua,

footnote.ft: Shammua is a variant of Shimea; see 1 Chronicles 3:5.

contents: Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

contents.verseText: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
contents: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

contents.verseText: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
contents: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

contents.verseText: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
contents: Elishama, Beeliada,

footnote.ft: Beeliada is a variant of Eliada; see 2 Samuel 5:16.

contents: and Eliphelet.

contents.verseText: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, they all went in search of him; but David learned of this and went out to face them.
contents: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, they all went in search of him; but David learned of this and went out to face them.

contents.verseText: Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim.
contents: Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim.

contents.verseText: So David inquired of God, “Should I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hand?” “Go,” replied the LORD, “for I will deliver them into your hand.”
contents: So David inquired of God, “Should I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hand?”
“Go,” replied the LORD, “for I will deliver them into your hand.”

contents.verseText: So David and his men went up to Baal-perazim, where he defeated the Philistines and said, “Like a bursting flood, God has burst out against my enemies by my hand.” So they called that place Baal-perazim.
contents: So David and his men went up to Baal-perazim, where he defeated the Philistines and said, “Like a bursting flood, God has burst out against my enemies by my hand.” So they called that place Baal-perazim.

footnote.ft: Baal-Perazim means The Lord Bursts Out.

contents.verseText: There the Philistines abandoned their gods, and David ordered that they be burned in the fire.
contents: There the Philistines abandoned their gods, and David ordered that they be burned in the fire.

contents.verseText: Once again the Philistines raided the valley.
contents: Once again the Philistines raided the valley.

contents.verseText: So David again inquired of God, who answered him, “Do not march up after them, but circle around them and attack them in front of the balsam trees.
contents: So David again inquired of God, who answered him, “Do not march up after them, but circle around them and attack them in front of the balsam trees.

footnote.ft: Or aspen trees or poplar trees; also in verse 15

contents.verseText: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, move out to battle, because this will mean that God has marched out before you to strike the camp of the Philistines.”
contents: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, move out to battle, because this will mean that God has marched out before you to strike the camp of the Philistines.”

contents.verseText: So David did as God had commanded him, and they struck down the army of the Philistines all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.
contents: So David did as God had commanded him, and they struck down the army of the Philistines all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.

contents.verseText: And David’s fame went out into every land, and the LORD caused all nations to fear him.
contents: And David’s fame went out into every land, and the LORD caused all nations to fear him.

contents.verseText: David constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
contents: David constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.

contents.verseText: Then David said, “No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the LORD has chosen them to carry the ark of the LORD and to minister before Him forever.”
contents: Then David said, “No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the LORD has chosen them to carry the ark of the LORD and to minister before Him forever.”

contents.verseText: And David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the LORD to the place he had prepared for it.
contents: And David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the LORD to the place he had prepared for it.

contents.verseText: Then he gathered together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites: 1
contents: Then he gathered together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:

contents.verseText: From the Kohathites, Uriel the chief and 120 of his relatives; 1
contents: From the Kohathites, Uriel the chief and 120 of his relatives;

contents.verseText: from the Merarites, Asaiah the chief and 220 of his relatives; 1
contents: from the Merarites, Asaiah the chief and 220 of his relatives;

contents.verseText: from the Gershomites, Joel the chief and 130 of his relatives; 1
contents: from the Gershomites,

footnote.ft: Gershomites is a variant of Gershonites; see 1 Chronicles 23:7.

contents: Joel the chief and 130 of his relatives;

contents.verseText: from the Elizaphanites, Shemaiah the chief and 200 of his relatives; 1
contents: from the Elizaphanites, Shemaiah the chief and 200 of his relatives;

contents.verseText: from the Hebronites, Eliel the chief and 80 of his relatives; 1
contents: from the Hebronites, Eliel the chief and 80 of his relatives;

contents.verseText: and from the Uzzielites, Amminadab the chief and 112 of his relatives.
contents: and from the Uzzielites, Amminadab the chief and 112 of his relatives.

contents.verseText: David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar and the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
contents: David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar and the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.

contents.verseText: And he said to them, “You are the heads of the Levitical families. You and your relatives must consecrate yourselves so that you may bring the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it.
contents: And he said to them, “You are the heads of the Levitical families. You and your relatives must consecrate yourselves so that you may bring the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it.

contents.verseText: It was because you Levites were not with us the first time that the LORD our God burst forth in anger against us. For we did not consult Him about the proper order.”
contents: It was because you Levites were not with us the first time that the LORD our God burst forth in anger against us. For we did not consult Him about the proper order.”

s1: The Priests and Levites Carry the Ark

contents.verseText: So the priests and Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.
contents: So the priests and Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.

contents.verseText: And the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the LORD.
contents: And the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the LORD.

contents.verseText: David also told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their relatives as singers to lift up their voices with joy, accompanied by musical instruments—harps, lyres, and cymbals.
contents: David also told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their relatives as singers to lift up their voices with joy, accompanied by musical instruments—harps, lyres, and cymbals.

contents.verseText: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; from his brothers, Asaph son of Berechiah; from their brothers the Merarites, Ethan son of Kushaiah;
contents: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; from his brothers, Asaph son of Berechiah; from their brothers the Merarites, Ethan son of Kushaiah;

contents.verseText: and with them their brothers next in rank: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, and the gatekeepers Obed-edom and Jeiel.
contents: and with them their brothers next in rank: Zechariah,

footnote.ft: Several Hebrew manuscripts and most LXX manuscripts (see also verse 20 and 1 Chronicles 16:5); most Hebrew manuscripts Zechariah son of or Zechariah, Ben,

contents: Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, and the gatekeepers Obed-edom and Jeiel.

footnote.ft: Hebrew; some LXX manuscripts Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah or Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Ozias

contents.verseText: The musicians Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were to sound the bronze cymbals.
contents: The musicians Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were to sound the bronze cymbals.

contents.verseText: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to play the harps according to Alamoth.
contents: Zechariah, Aziel,

footnote.ft: Aziel is a variant of Jaaziel; see verse 18.

contents: Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to play the harps according to Alamoth.

footnote.ft: Alamoth is probably a musical or liturgical term; here and in Psalm 46:1.

contents.verseText: And Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to lead the music with lyres according to Sheminith.
contents: And Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to lead the music with lyres according to Sheminith.

footnote.ft: Sheminith is probably a musical term; here and in Psalm 6:1 and Psalm 12:1.

contents.verseText: Chenaniah the head Levite was the director of the music because he was highly skilled.
contents: Chenaniah the head Levite was the director of the music because he was highly skilled.

contents.verseText: Berechiah and Elkanah were to be guardians of the ark.
contents: Berechiah and Elkanah were to be guardians

footnote.ft: Literally gatekeepers; also in verse 24

contents: of the ark.

contents.verseText: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer—the priests—were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah were also to be guardians of the ark.
contents: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer—the priests—were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah were also to be guardians of the ark.

contents.verseText: So David, the elders of Israel, and the commanders of thousands went with rejoicing to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom.
contents: So David, the elders of Israel, and the commanders of thousands went with rejoicing to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom.

contents.verseText: And because God helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
contents: And because God helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.

contents.verseText: Now David was dressed in a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, as well as the singers and Chenaniah, the director of music for the singers. David also wore a linen ephod.
contents: Now David was dressed in a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, as well as the singers and Chenaniah, the director of music for the singers. David also wore a linen ephod.
