contents.verseText: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting, with the sounding of rams’ horns and trumpets, and with cymbals and the music of harps and lyres.
contents: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting, with the sounding of rams’ horns and trumpets, and with cymbals and the music of harps and lyres.

contents.verseText: As the ark of the covenant of the LORD was entering the City of David, Saul’s daughter Michal looked down from a window and saw King David dancing and celebrating, and she despised him in her heart.
contents: As the ark of the covenant of the LORD was entering the City of David, Saul’s daughter Michal looked down from a window and saw King David dancing and celebrating, and she despised him in her heart.

contents.verseText: So they brought the ark of God and placed it inside the tent that David had pitched for it. And they presented burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
contents: So they brought the ark of God and placed it inside the tent that David had pitched for it. And they presented burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.

contents.verseText: When David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
contents: When David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

contents.verseText: Then he distributed to every man and woman of Israel a loaf of bread, a date cake, and a raisin cake.
contents: Then he distributed to every man and woman of Israel a loaf of bread, a date cake,

footnote.ft: Or a portion of meat

contents: and a raisin cake.

contents.verseText: David appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, to celebrate, to give thanks, and to praise the LORD, the God of Israel.
contents: David appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, to celebrate, to give thanks, and to praise the LORD, the God of Israel.

contents.verseText: Asaph was the chief, Zechariah was second, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel. They were to play the harps and lyres, while Asaph sounded the cymbals
contents: Asaph was the chief, Zechariah was second, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel. They were to play the harps and lyres, while Asaph sounded the cymbals

contents.verseText: and the priests Benaiah and Jahaziel blew the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
contents: and the priests Benaiah and Jahaziel blew the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.

contents.verseText: On that day David first committed to Asaph and his brothers this song of thanksgiving to the LORD:
contents: On that day David first committed to Asaph and his brothers this song of thanksgiving to the LORD:

contents.verseText: “Give thanks to the LORD; call upon His name; make known His deeds among the nations.
contents: “Give thanks to the LORD; call upon His name;
make known His deeds among the nations.

contents.verseText: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him; tell of all His wonders.
contents: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
tell of all His wonders.

contents.verseText: Glory in His holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
contents: Glory in His holy name;
let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.

contents.verseText: Seek out the LORD and His strength; seek His face always.
contents: Seek out the LORD and His strength;
seek His face always.

contents.verseText: Remember the wonders He has done, His marvels, and the judgments He has pronounced,
contents: Remember the wonders He has done,
His marvels, and the judgments He has pronounced,

contents.verseText: O offspring of His servant Israel, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.
contents: O offspring of His servant Israel,
O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.

contents.verseText: He is the LORD our God; His judgments carry throughout the earth.
contents: He is the LORD our God;
His judgments carry throughout the earth.

contents.verseText: Remember His covenant forever, the word He ordained for a thousand generations—
contents: Remember

footnote.ft: Hebrew; some LXX manuscripts He remembers; see Psalm 105:8.

contents: His covenant forever,
the word He ordained for a thousand generations—

contents.verseText: the covenant He made with Abraham, and the oath He swore to Isaac.
contents: the covenant He made with Abraham,
and the oath He swore to Isaac.

contents.verseText: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
contents: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree,
to Israel as an everlasting covenant:

contents.verseText: ‘I will give you the land of Canaan as the portion of your inheritance.’
contents: ‘I will give you the land of Canaan
as the portion of your inheritance.’

contents.verseText: When they were few in number, few indeed, and strangers in the land,
contents: When they were few in number,
few indeed, and strangers in the land,

contents.verseText: they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
contents: they wandered from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another.

contents.verseText: He let no man oppress them; He rebuked kings on their behalf:
contents: He let no man oppress them;
He rebuked kings on their behalf:

contents.verseText: ‘Do not touch My anointed ones! Do no harm to My prophets!’
contents: ‘Do not touch My anointed ones!
Do no harm to My prophets!’

s1: Sing to the LORD, All the Earth

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD, all the earth. Proclaim His salvation day after day.
contents: Sing to the LORD, all the earth.
Proclaim His salvation day after day.

contents.verseText: Declare His glory among the nations, His wonderful deeds among all peoples.
contents: Declare His glory among the nations,
His wonderful deeds among all peoples.

contents.verseText: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
contents: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised;
He is to be feared above all gods.

contents.verseText: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but it is the LORD who made the heavens.
contents: For all the gods of the nations are idols,
but it is the LORD who made the heavens.

contents.verseText: Splendor and majesty are before Him; strength and joy fill His dwelling.
contents: Splendor and majesty are before Him;
strength and joy fill His dwelling.

contents.verseText: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
contents: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the nations,
ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

contents.verseText: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name; bring an offering and come before Him. Worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness;
contents: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name;
bring an offering and come before Him.
Worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness;

contents.verseText: tremble before Him, all the earth. The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.
contents: tremble before Him, all the earth.
The world is firmly established;
it cannot be moved.

contents.verseText: Let the heavens be glad, and the earth rejoice. Let them say among the nations, ‘The LORD reigns!’
contents: Let the heavens be glad,
and the earth rejoice.
Let them say among the nations,
‘The LORD reigns!’

contents.verseText: Let the sea resound, and all that fills it; let the fields exult, and all that is in them.
contents: Let the sea resound,
and all that fills it;
let the fields exult,
and all that is in them.

contents.verseText: Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the LORD, for He is coming to judge the earth.
contents: Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the LORD,
for He is coming to judge the earth.

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good;
His loving devotion

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew chesed are translated here and in most cases throughout the Scriptures as loving devotion; the range of meaning includes love, goodness, kindness, faithfulness, and mercy, as well as loyalty to a covenant.

contents: endures forever.

contents.verseText: Then cry out: ‘Save us, O God of our salvation; gather and deliver us from the nations, that we may give thanks to Your holy name, that we may glory in Your praise.’
contents: Then cry out: ‘Save us, O God of our salvation;
gather and deliver us from the nations,
that we may give thanks to Your holy name,
that we may glory in Your praise.’

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.” Then all the people said, “Amen!” and “Praise the LORD!”
contents: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel,
from everlasting to everlasting.”
Then all the people said, “Amen!” and “Praise the LORD!”

contents.verseText: So David left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to minister there regularly according to the daily requirements,
contents: So David left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to minister there regularly according to the daily requirements,

contents.verseText: along with Obed-edom and his sixty-eight relatives. Obed-edom son of Jeduthun, and also Hosah, were to be gatekeepers.
contents: along with Obed-edom and his sixty-eight relatives. Obed-edom son of Jeduthun, and also Hosah, were to be gatekeepers.

contents.verseText: And David left Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the LORD at the high place in Gibeon
contents: And David left Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the LORD at the high place in Gibeon

contents.verseText: to regularly present burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offerings, morning and evening, according to all that was written in the Law of the LORD, which He had commanded Israel to keep.
contents: to regularly present burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offerings, morning and evening, according to all that was written in the Law of the LORD, which He had commanded Israel to keep.

contents.verseText: With them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the LORD, for “His loving devotion endures forever.”
contents: With them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the LORD, for “His loving devotion endures forever.”

contents.verseText: Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals for the music and instruments for the songs of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were stationed at the gate.
contents: Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals for the music and instruments for the songs of God.

footnote.ft: Or instruments for the sacred music

contents: And the sons of Jeduthun were stationed at the gate.

contents.verseText: Then all the people departed for their homes, and David returned home to bless his household.
contents: Then all the people departed for their homes, and David returned home to bless his household.

contents.verseText: After David had settled into his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Here I am, living in a house of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under a tent.”
contents: After David had settled into his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Here I am, living in a house of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under a tent.”

contents.verseText: And Nathan replied to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.”
contents: And Nathan replied to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.”

contents.verseText: But that night the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
contents: But that night the word of God came to Nathan, saying,

contents.verseText: “Go and tell My servant David that this is what the LORD says: You are not the one to build Me a house in which to dwell.
contents: “Go and tell My servant David that this is what the LORD says: You are not the one to build Me a house in which to dwell.

contents.verseText: For I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought Israel up out of Egypt until this day, but I have moved from tent to tent and dwelling to dwelling.
contents: For I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought Israel up out of Egypt

footnote.ft: Out of Egypt is implied, but not included in the Hebrew; see 2 Samuel 7:6.

contents: until this day, but I have moved from tent to tent and dwelling to dwelling.

contents.verseText: In all My journeys with all the Israelites, have I ever asked any of the leaders I appointed to shepherd My people, ‘Why haven’t you built Me a house of cedar?’
contents: In all My journeys with all the Israelites, have I ever asked any of the leaders

footnote.ft: Or judges; see verse 10.

contents: I appointed to shepherd My people, ‘Why haven’t you built Me a house of cedar?’

contents.verseText: Now then, you are to tell My servant David that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be the ruler over My people Israel.
contents: Now then, you are to tell My servant David that this is what the LORD of Hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be the ruler over My people Israel.

contents.verseText: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make for you a name like the greatest in the land.
contents: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make for you a name like the greatest in the land.

contents.verseText: And I will provide a place for My people Israel and will plant them so that they may dwell in a place of their own and be disturbed no more. No longer will the sons of wickedness oppress them as they did at the beginning
contents: And I will provide a place for My people Israel and will plant them so that they may dwell in a place of their own and be disturbed no more. No longer will the sons of wickedness oppress them as they did at the beginning

contents.verseText: and have done since the day I appointed judges over My people Israel. And I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover, I declare to you that the LORD will build a house for you.
contents: and have done since the day I appointed judges over My people Israel. And I will subdue all your enemies.
Moreover, I declare to you that the LORD will build a house for you.

contents.verseText: And when your days are fulfilled and you go to be with your fathers, I will raise up your descendant after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
contents: And when your days are fulfilled and you go to be with your fathers, I will raise up your descendant after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.

contents.verseText: He will build a house for Me, and I will establish his throne forever.
contents: He will build a house for Me, and I will establish his throne forever.

contents.verseText: I will be his Father, and he will be My son. And I will never remove My loving devotion from him as I removed it from your predecessor.
contents: I will be his Father, and he will be My son. And I will never remove My loving devotion from him as I removed it from your predecessor.

contents.verseText: But I will set him over My house and My kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever.”
contents: But I will set him over My house and My kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever.”

contents.verseText: So Nathan relayed to David all the words of this entire vision.
contents: So Nathan relayed to David all the words of this entire vision.

contents.verseText: Then King David went in, sat before the LORD, and said, “Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that You have brought me this far?
contents: Then King David went in, sat before the LORD, and said, “Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that You have brought me this far?

contents.verseText: And as if this was a small thing in Your eyes, O God, You have spoken about the future of the house of Your servant and have regarded me as a man of great distinction, O LORD God.
contents: And as if this was a small thing in Your eyes, O God, You have spoken about the future of the house of Your servant and have regarded me as a man of great distinction,

footnote.ft: Or and have shown me future generations

contents: O LORD God.

contents.verseText: What more can David say to You for so honoring Your servant? For You know Your servant,
contents: What more can David say to You for so honoring Your servant? For You know Your servant,

contents.verseText: O LORD. For the sake of Your servant and according to Your own heart, You have accomplished this great thing and revealed all Your greatness.
contents: O LORD.

footnote.ft: See 2 Samuel 7:20; many translators 18...For You know Your servant. 19 O LORD,

contents: For the sake of Your servant and according to Your own heart, You have accomplished this great thing and revealed all Your greatness.

contents.verseText: O LORD, there is none like You, and there is no God but You, according to everything we have heard with our own ears.
contents: O LORD, there is none like You, and there is no God but You, according to everything we have heard with our own ears.

contents.verseText: And who is like Your people Israel—the one nation on earth whom God went out to redeem as a people for Himself? You made a name for Yourself through great and awesome wonders by driving out nations from before Your people, whom You redeemed from Egypt.
contents: And who is like Your people Israel—the one nation on earth whom God went out to redeem as a people for Himself? You made a name for Yourself through great and awesome wonders by driving out nations from before Your people, whom You redeemed from Egypt.

contents.verseText: For You have made Your people Israel Your very own forever, and You, O LORD, have become their God.
contents: For You have made Your people Israel Your very own forever, and You, O LORD, have become their God.

contents.verseText: And now, O LORD, let the word You have spoken concerning Your servant and his house be established forever. Do as You have promised,
contents: And now, O LORD, let the word You have spoken concerning Your servant and his house be established forever. Do as You have promised,

contents.verseText: so that Your name will be established and magnified forever when it is said, ‘The LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, is God over Israel.’ And may the house of Your servant David be established before You.
contents: so that Your name will be established and magnified forever when it is said, ‘The LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, is God over Israel.’ And may the house of Your servant David be established before You.

contents.verseText: For You, my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him. Therefore Your servant has found the courage to pray before You.
contents: For You, my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him. Therefore Your servant has found the courage to pray before You.

contents.verseText: And now, O LORD, You are God! And You have promised this goodness to Your servant.
contents: And now, O LORD, You are God! And You have promised this goodness to Your servant.

contents.verseText: So now You have been pleased to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue forever before You. For You, O LORD, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever.”
contents: So now You have been pleased to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue forever before You. For You, O LORD, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever.”

contents.verseText: Some time later, David defeated the Philistines, subdued them, and took Gath and its villages from the hand of the Philistines.
contents: Some time later, David defeated the Philistines, subdued them, and took Gath and its villages from the hand of the Philistines.

contents.verseText: David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to David and brought him tribute.
contents: David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to David and brought him tribute.

contents.verseText: As far as Hamath, David also defeated King Hadadezer of Zobah, who had marched out to establish his dominion along the Euphrates River.
contents: As far as Hamath, David also defeated King Hadadezer of Zobah, who had marched out to establish his dominion

footnote.ft: Hebrew his hand

contents: along the Euphrates River.

contents.verseText: David captured from him a thousand chariots, seven thousand charioteers, and twenty thousand foot soldiers, and he hamstrung all the horses except a hundred he kept for the chariots.
contents: David captured from him a thousand chariots, seven thousand charioteers, and twenty thousand foot soldiers, and he hamstrung all the horses except a hundred he kept for the chariots.

contents.verseText: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand men.
contents: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand men.

contents.verseText: Then he placed garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to David and brought him tribute. So the LORD made David victorious wherever he went.
contents: Then he placed garrisons

footnote.ft: LXX and Vulgate (see also 2 Samuel 8:6 and Syriac); Hebrew does not include garrisons.

contents: in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to David and brought him tribute. So the LORD made David victorious

footnote.ft: Or the LORD saved David; also in verse 13

contents: wherever he went.

contents.verseText: And David took the gold shields that belonged to the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
contents: And David took the gold shields that belonged to the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: And from Tibhath and Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took a large amount of bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze Sea, the pillars, and various bronze articles.
contents: And from Tibhath

footnote.ft: Tibhath is a variant of Tebah; see 2 Samuel 8:8 LXX.

contents: and Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took a large amount of bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze Sea, the pillars, and various bronze articles.

contents.verseText: When King Tou of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
contents: When King Tou

footnote.ft: Tou is a variant of Toi; also in verse 10; see 2 Samuel 8:9.

contents: of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,

contents.verseText: he sent his son Hadoram to greet King David and bless him for fighting and defeating Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold and silver and bronze,
contents: he sent his son Hadoram

footnote.ft: Hadoram is a variant of Joram; see 2 Samuel 8:10.

contents: to greet King David and bless him for fighting and defeating Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold and silver and bronze,

contents.verseText: and King David dedicated these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold he had carried off from all these nations—from Edom and Moab, and from the Ammonites, Philistines, and Amalekites.
contents: and King David dedicated these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold he had carried off from all these nations—from Edom and Moab, and from the Ammonites, Philistines, and Amalekites.

contents.verseText: Moreover, Abishai son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
contents: Moreover, Abishai son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

contents.verseText: He placed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites were subject to David. So the LORD made David victorious wherever he went.
contents: He placed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites were subject to David. So the LORD made David victorious wherever he went.

contents.verseText: Thus David reigned over all Israel and administered justice and righteousness for all his people: 1
contents: Thus David reigned over all Israel and administered justice and righteousness for all his people:

contents.verseText: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the recorder; 1
contents: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army;

li1: Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was the recorder;

contents.verseText: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was the scribe; 1
contents: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech

footnote.ft: Some Hebrew manuscripts, Vulgate, and Syriac (see also 2 Samuel 8:17); most Hebrew manuscripts Abimelech

contents: son of Abiathar were priests;

li1: Shavsha

footnote.ft: Shavsha is also called Seraiah, Sheva, and Shisha; see 2 Samuel 8:17, 2 Samuel 20:25, and 1 Kings 4:3.

contents: was the scribe;

contents.verseText: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief officials at the king’s side.
contents: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and Pelethites;

li1: and David’s sons were chief officials at the king’s side.

contents.verseText: Some time later, Nahash king of the Ammonites died and was succeeded by his son.
contents: Some time later, Nahash king of the Ammonites died and was succeeded by his son.

contents.verseText: And David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to console Hanun concerning his father. But when David’s servants arrived in the land of the Ammonites to console him,
contents: And David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.”
So David sent messengers to console Hanun concerning his father. But when David’s servants arrived in the land of the Ammonites to console him,

contents.verseText: the princes of the Ammonites said to Hanun, “Just because David has sent you comforters, do you really believe he is showing respect for your father? Have not his servants come to you to explore the land, spy it out, and overthrow it?”
contents: the princes of the Ammonites said to Hanun, “Just because David has sent you comforters, do you really believe he is showing respect for your father? Have not his servants come to you to explore the land, spy it out, and overthrow it?”

contents.verseText: So Hanun took David’s servants, shaved their beards, cut off their garments at the hips, and sent them away.
contents: So Hanun took David’s servants, shaved their beards, cut off their garments at the hips, and sent them away.

contents.verseText: When someone came and told David about his men, he sent messengers to meet them, since the men had been thoroughly humiliated. The king told them, “Stay in Jericho until your beards have grown back, and then return.”
contents: When someone came and told David about his men, he sent messengers to meet them, since the men had been thoroughly humiliated. The king told them, “Stay in Jericho until your beards have grown back, and then return.”

contents.verseText: When the Ammonites realized that they had become a stench to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Aram-naharaim, Aram-maacah, and Zobah.
contents: When the Ammonites realized that they had become a stench to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver

footnote.ft: 1,000 talents is approximately 37.7 tons or 34.2 metric tons of silver.

contents: to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Aram-naharaim,

footnote.ft: That is, Mesopotamia; Aram-naharaim means Aram of the two rivers, likely the region between the Euphrates and Balih Rivers in northwestern Mesopotamia.

contents: Aram-maacah, and Zobah.

contents.verseText: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, as well as the king of Maacah with his troops, who came and camped near Medeba while the Ammonites came from their cities and marched out for battle.
contents: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, as well as the king of Maacah with his troops, who came and camped near Medeba while the Ammonites came from their cities and marched out for battle.

contents.verseText: On hearing this, David sent Joab and the entire army of mighty men.
contents: On hearing this, David sent Joab and the entire army of mighty men.

contents.verseText: The Ammonites marched out and arrayed themselves for battle at the entrance to the city, while the kings who had come stayed by themselves in the open country.
contents: The Ammonites marched out and arrayed themselves for battle at the entrance to the city, while the kings who had come stayed by themselves in the open country.

contents.verseText: When Joab saw the battle lines before him and behind him, he selected some of the best men of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans.
contents: When Joab saw the battle lines before him and behind him, he selected some of the best men of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans.

contents.verseText: And he placed the rest of the forces under the command of his brother Abishai, who arrayed them against the Ammonites.
contents: And he placed the rest of the forces under the command of his brother Abishai, who arrayed them against the Ammonites.

contents.verseText: “If the Arameans are too strong for me,” said Joab, “then you will come to my rescue. And if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will come to your rescue.
contents: “If the Arameans are too strong for me,” said Joab, “then you will come to my rescue. And if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will come to your rescue.

contents.verseText: Be strong and let us fight bravely for our people and for the cities of our God. May the LORD do what is good in His sight.”
contents: Be strong and let us fight bravely for our people and for the cities of our God. May the LORD do what is good in His sight.”

contents.verseText: So Joab and his troops advanced to fight the Arameans, who fled before him.
contents: So Joab and his troops advanced to fight the Arameans, who fled before him.

contents.verseText: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they too fled before Joab’s brother Abishai, and they entered the city. So Joab went back to Jerusalem.
contents: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they too fled before Joab’s brother Abishai, and they entered the city. So Joab went back to Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: When the Arameans saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers to bring more Arameans from beyond the Euphrates, with Shophach the commander of Hadadezer’s army leading them.
contents: When the Arameans saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers to bring more Arameans from beyond the Euphrates,

footnote.ft: Hebrew the River

contents: with Shophach

footnote.ft: Shophach is a variant of Shobach; also in verse 18; see 2 Samuel 10:16.

contents: the commander of Hadadezer’s army leading them.

contents.verseText: When this was reported to David, he gathered all Israel, crossed the Jordan, advanced toward the Arameans, and arrayed for battle against them. When David lined up to engage them in battle, they fought against him.
contents: When this was reported to David, he gathered all Israel, crossed the Jordan, advanced toward the Arameans, and arrayed for battle against them. When David lined up to engage them in battle, they fought against him.

contents.verseText: But the Arameans fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers. He also killed Shophach the commander of their army.
contents: But the Arameans fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers. He also killed Shophach the commander of their army.

contents.verseText: When Hadadezer’s subjects saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him. So the Arameans were unwilling to help the Ammonites anymore.
contents: When Hadadezer’s subjects saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him. So the Arameans were unwilling to help the Ammonites anymore.

contents.verseText: In the spring, at the time when kings march out to war, Joab led out the army and ravaged the land of the Ammonites. He came to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem. And Joab attacked Rabbah and demolished it.
contents: In the spring,

footnote.ft: Literally At the turn of the year

contents: at the time when kings march out to war, Joab led out the army and ravaged the land of the Ammonites. He came to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem. And Joab attacked Rabbah and demolished it.

contents.verseText: Then David took the crown from the head of their king. It was found to weigh a talent of gold and was set with precious stones, and it was placed on David’s head. And David took a great amount of plunder from the city.
contents: Then David took the crown from the head of their king.

footnote.ft: Or from the head of Milcom. Milcom, also called Molech, was god of the Ammonites; see Leviticus 18:21 and 1 Kings 11:7.

contents: It was found to weigh a talent of gold

footnote.ft: A talent is approximately 75.4 pounds or 34.2 kilograms of gold.

contents: and was set with precious stones, and it was placed on David’s head. And David took a great amount of plunder from the city.

contents.verseText: David brought out the people who were there and put them to work with saws, iron picks, and axes. And he did the same to all the Ammonite cities. Then David and all his troops returned to Jerusalem.
contents: David brought out the people who were there and put them to work

footnote.ft: Or cut them

contents: with saws, iron picks, and axes. And he did the same to all the Ammonite cities. Then David and all his troops returned to Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Some time later, war broke out with the Philistines at Gezer. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the Rephaim, and the Philistines were subdued.
contents: Some time later, war broke out with the Philistines at Gezer. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai,

footnote.ft: Sippai is a variant of Saph; see 2 Samuel 21:18.

contents: a descendant of the Rephaim,

footnote.ft: Or the giants; see also descendants of Rapha in verses 6 and 8.

contents: and the Philistines were subdued.

contents.verseText: Once again there was a battle with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
contents: Once again there was a battle with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother

footnote.ft: Or Elhanan son of Jair the Bethlehemite killed the brother; see 2 Samuel 21:19.

contents: of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.

contents.verseText: And there was still another battle at Gath, where there was a man of great stature with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot—twenty-four in all. He too was descended from Rapha,
contents: And there was still another battle at Gath, where there was a man of great stature with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot—twenty-four in all. He too was descended from Rapha,

contents.verseText: and when he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of David’s brother Shimei killed him.
contents: and when he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of David’s brother Shimei killed him.

contents.verseText: So these descendants of Rapha in Gath fell at the hands of David and his servants.
contents: So these descendants of Rapha in Gath fell at the hands of David and his servants.

contents.verseText: Then Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
contents: Then Satan

footnote.ft: That is, the Accuser or the Adversary

contents: rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.

contents.verseText: So David said to Joab and the commanders of the troops, “Go and count the Israelites from Beersheba to Dan and bring me a report, so that I may know their number.”
contents: So David said to Joab and the commanders of the troops, “Go and count the Israelites from Beersheba to Dan and bring me a report, so that I may know their number.”

contents.verseText: But Joab replied, “May the LORD multiply His troops a hundred times over. My lord the king, are they not all servants of my lord? Why does my lord want to do this? Why should he bring guilt on Israel?”
contents: But Joab replied, “May the LORD multiply His troops a hundred times over. My lord the king, are they not all servants of my lord? Why does my lord want to do this? Why should he bring guilt on Israel?”

contents.verseText: Nevertheless, the king’s word prevailed against Joab. So Joab departed and traveled throughout Israel, and then he returned to Jerusalem.
contents: Nevertheless, the king’s word prevailed against Joab. So Joab departed and traveled throughout Israel, and then he returned to Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: And Joab reported to David the total number of the troops. In all Israel there were 1,100,000 men who drew the sword, including 470,000 in Judah.
contents: And Joab reported to David the total number of the troops. In all Israel there were 1,100,000 men who drew the sword, including 470,000 in Judah.

contents.verseText: But Joab did not include Levi and Benjamin in the count, because the king’s command was detestable to him.
contents: But Joab did not include Levi and Benjamin in the count, because the king’s command was detestable to him.

contents.verseText: This command was also evil in the sight of God; so He struck Israel.
contents: This command was also evil in the sight of God; so He struck Israel.

contents.verseText: Then David said to God, “I have sinned greatly because I have done this thing. Now I beg You to take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have acted very foolishly.”
contents: Then David said to God, “I have sinned greatly because I have done this thing. Now I beg You to take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have acted very foolishly.”

contents.verseText: And the LORD instructed Gad, David’s seer,
contents: And the LORD instructed Gad, David’s seer,

contents.verseText: “Go and tell David that this is what the LORD says: ‘I am offering you three options. Choose one of them, and I will carry it out against you.’”
contents: “Go and tell David that this is what the LORD says: ‘I am offering you three options. Choose one of them, and I will carry it out against you.’”

contents.verseText: So Gad went and said to David, “This is what the LORD says: ‘You must choose
contents: So Gad went and said to David, “This is what the LORD says: ‘You must choose

contents.verseText: between three years of famine, three months of being swept away before your enemies and overtaken by their swords, or three days of the sword of the LORD—days of plague upon the land, with the angel of the LORD ravaging every part of Israel.’ Now then, decide how I should reply to Him who sent me.”
contents: between three years of famine, three months of being swept away

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX and Vulgate of fleeing; see 2 Samuel 24:13.

contents: before your enemies and overtaken by their swords, or three days of the sword of the LORD—days of plague upon the land, with the angel of the LORD ravaging every part of Israel.’ Now then, decide how I should reply to Him who sent me.”

contents.verseText: David answered Gad, “I am deeply distressed. Please, let me fall into the hand of the LORD, for His mercies are very great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men.”
contents: David answered Gad, “I am deeply distressed. Please, let me fall into the hand of the LORD, for His mercies are very great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men.”

contents.verseText: So the LORD sent a plague upon Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell dead.
contents: So the LORD sent a plague upon Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell dead.

contents.verseText: Then God sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem, but as the angel was doing so, the LORD saw it and relented from the calamity, and He said to the angel who was destroying the people, “Enough! Withdraw your hand now!” At that time the angel of the LORD was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
contents: Then God sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem, but as the angel was doing so, the LORD saw it and relented from the calamity, and He said to the angel who was destroying the people, “Enough! Withdraw your hand now!”
At that time the angel of the LORD was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan

footnote.ft: Ornan is a variant of Araunah; also in verses 18–28; see 2 Samuel 24:16.

contents: the Jebusite.

contents.verseText: When David lifted up his eyes and saw the angel of the LORD standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem, David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell facedown.
contents: When David lifted up his eyes and saw the angel of the LORD standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem, David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell facedown.

contents.verseText: And David said to God, “Was it not I who gave the order to count the people? I am the one who has sinned and acted wickedly. But these sheep, what have they done? O LORD my God, please let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house, but do not let this plague remain upon Your people.”
contents: And David said to God, “Was it not I who gave the order to count the people? I

footnote.ft: Or I, the shepherd, see 2 Samuel 24:17 DSS and LXX.

contents: am the one who has sinned and acted wickedly. But these sheep, what have they done? O LORD my God, please let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house, but do not let this plague remain upon Your people.”

contents.verseText: Then the angel of the LORD ordered Gad to tell David to go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
contents: Then the angel of the LORD ordered Gad to tell David to go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

contents.verseText: So David went up at the word that Gad had spoken in the name of the LORD.
contents: So David went up at the word that Gad had spoken in the name of the LORD.

contents.verseText: Now Ornan was threshing wheat when he turned and saw the angel; and his four sons who were with him hid themselves.
contents: Now Ornan was threshing wheat when he turned and saw the angel; and his four sons who were with him hid themselves.

contents.verseText: David came to Ornan, and when Ornan looked out and saw David, he left the threshing floor and bowed facedown before David.
contents: David came to Ornan, and when Ornan looked out and saw David, he left the threshing floor and bowed facedown before David.

contents.verseText: Then David said to Ornan, “Grant me the site of this threshing floor, that I may build an altar to the LORD. Sell it to me for the full price, so that the plague upon the people may be halted.”
contents: Then David said to Ornan, “Grant me the site of this threshing floor, that I may build an altar to the LORD. Sell it to me for the full price, so that the plague upon the people may be halted.”

contents.verseText: Ornan said to David, “My lord the king may take whatever seems good. Look, I will give the oxen for the burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for the wood, and the wheat for the grain offering—I will give it all.”
contents: Ornan said to David, “My lord the king may take whatever seems good. Look, I will give the oxen for the burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for the wood, and the wheat for the grain offering—I will give it all.”

contents.verseText: “No,” replied King David, “I insist on paying the full price, for I will not take for the LORD what belongs to you, nor will I offer burnt offerings that cost me nothing.”
contents: “No,” replied King David, “I insist on paying the full price, for I will not take for the LORD what belongs to you, nor will I offer burnt offerings that cost me nothing.”

contents.verseText: So David paid Ornan six hundred shekels of gold for the site.
contents: So David paid Ornan six hundred shekels of gold

footnote.ft: 600 shekels is approximately 15.1 pounds or 6.8 kilograms of gold.

contents: for the site.

contents.verseText: And there he built an altar to the LORD and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. He called upon the LORD, who answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.
contents: And there he built an altar to the LORD and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. He called upon the LORD, who answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD spoke to the angel, who put his sword back into its sheath.
contents: Then the LORD spoke to the angel, who put his sword back into its sheath.

contents.verseText: At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there.
contents: At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there.

contents.verseText: For the tabernacle of the LORD that Moses had made in the wilderness and the altar of burnt offering were presently at the high place in Gibeon,
contents: For the tabernacle of the LORD that Moses had made in the wilderness and the altar of burnt offering were presently at the high place in Gibeon,

contents.verseText: but David could not go before it to inquire of God, because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
contents: but David could not go before it to inquire of God, because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the LORD.

contents.verseText: Then David said, “Here shall be the house of the LORD God, as well as the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
contents: Then David said, “Here shall be the house of the LORD God, as well as the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”

contents.verseText: So David gave orders to gather the foreigners in the land of Israel, from whom he appointed stonecutters to prepare finished stones for building the house of God.
contents: So David gave orders to gather the foreigners in the land of Israel, from whom he appointed stonecutters to prepare finished stones for building the house of God.

contents.verseText: David provided a large quantity of iron to make the nails for the doors of the gateways and for the fittings, together with more bronze than could be weighed
contents: David provided a large quantity of iron to make the nails for the doors of the gateways and for the fittings, together with more bronze than could be weighed

contents.verseText: and more cedar logs than could be counted; for the Sidonians and Tyrians had brought a large quantity of cedar logs to David.
contents: and more cedar logs than could be counted; for the Sidonians and Tyrians had brought a large quantity of cedar logs to David.

contents.verseText: And David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD must be exceedingly magnificent—famous and glorious throughout all lands. Therefore I must make preparations for it.” So David made lavish preparations before his death.
contents: And David said, “My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD must be exceedingly magnificent—famous and glorious throughout all lands. Therefore I must make preparations for it.” So David made lavish preparations before his death.

s1: Solomon Anointed to Build the Temple

contents.verseText: Then David called for his son Solomon and instructed him to build a house for the LORD, the God of Israel.
contents: Then David called for his son Solomon and instructed him to build a house for the LORD, the God of Israel.

contents.verseText: “My son,” said David to Solomon, “it was in my heart to build a house for the Name of the LORD my God,
contents: “My son,” said David to Solomon, “it was in my heart to build a house for the Name of the LORD my God,

contents.verseText: but this word of the LORD came to me: ‘You have shed much blood and waged great wars. You are not to build a house for My Name because you have shed so much blood on the ground before Me.
contents: but this word of the LORD came to me: ‘You have shed much blood and waged great wars. You are not to build a house for My Name because you have shed so much blood on the ground before Me.

contents.verseText: But a son will be born to you who will be a man of rest. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side; for his name will be Solomon, and I will grant to Israel peace and quiet during his reign.
contents: But a son will be born to you who will be a man of rest. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side; for his name will be Solomon,

footnote.ft: Solomon sounds like and is probably derived from the Hebrew word for peace.

contents: and I will grant to Israel peace and quiet during his reign.

contents.verseText: He is the one who will build a house for My Name. He will be My son, and I will be his Father. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
contents: He is the one who will build a house for My Name. He will be My son, and I will be his Father. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’

contents.verseText: Now, my son, may the LORD be with you, and may you succeed in building the house of the LORD your God, as He said you would.
contents: Now, my son, may the LORD be with you, and may you succeed in building the house of the LORD your God, as He said you would.

contents.verseText: Above all, may the LORD give you insight and understanding when He puts you in command over Israel, so that you may keep the Law of the LORD your God.
contents: Above all, may the LORD give you insight and understanding when He puts you in command over Israel, so that you may keep the Law of the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: Then you will succeed, if you carefully follow the statutes and ordinances that the LORD commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.
contents: Then you will succeed, if you carefully follow the statutes and ordinances that the LORD commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.

contents.verseText: Now behold, I have taken great pains to provide for the house of the LORD—100,000 talents of gold, 1,000,000 talents of silver, and bronze and iron too great to be weighed. I have also provided timber and stone, and you may add to them.
contents: Now behold, I have taken great pains to provide for the house of the LORD—100,000 talents of gold,

footnote.ft: 100,000 talents is approximately 3,770 tons or 3,420 metric tons of gold.

contents: 1,000,000 talents of silver,

footnote.ft: 1,000,000 talents is approximately 37,700 tons or 34,200 metric tons of silver.

contents: and bronze and iron too great to be weighed. I have also provided timber and stone, and you may add to them.

contents.verseText: You also have many workers: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and men skilled in every kind of work—
contents: You also have many workers: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and men skilled in every kind of work—

contents.verseText: in gold and silver, bronze and iron—craftsmen beyond number. Now begin the work, and may the LORD be with you.”
contents: in gold and silver, bronze and iron—craftsmen beyond number. Now begin the work, and may the LORD be with you.”

contents.verseText: Then David ordered all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon:
contents: Then David ordered all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon:

contents.verseText: “Is not the LORD your God with you, and has He not granted you rest on every side? For He has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land has been subdued before the LORD and His people.
contents: “Is not the LORD your God with you, and has He not granted you rest on every side? For He has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land has been subdued before the LORD and His people.

contents.verseText: Now set your heart and soul to seek the LORD your God. Get started building the sanctuary of the LORD God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy articles of God into the temple that will be built for the Name of the LORD.”
contents: Now set your heart and soul to seek the LORD your God. Get started building the sanctuary of the LORD God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy articles of God into the temple that will be built for the Name of the LORD.”

contents.verseText: When David was old and full of years, he installed his son Solomon as king over Israel.
contents: When David was old and full of years, he installed his son Solomon as king over Israel.

contents.verseText: Then he gathered all the leaders of Israel, as well as the priests and Levites.
contents: Then he gathered all the leaders of Israel, as well as the priests and Levites.

contents.verseText: The Levites thirty years of age or older were counted, and the total number of men was 38,000.
contents: The Levites thirty years of age or older were counted, and the total number of men was 38,000.

contents.verseText: “Of these,” said David, “24,000 are to oversee the work of the house of the LORD, 6,000 are to be officers and judges,
contents: “Of these,” said David,

footnote.ft: Hebrew does not include said David,

contents: “24,000 are to oversee the work of the house of the LORD, 6,000 are to be officers and judges,

contents.verseText: 4,000 are to be gatekeepers, and 4,000 are to praise the LORD with the instruments I have made for giving praise.”
contents: 4,000 are to be gatekeepers, and 4,000 are to praise the LORD with the instruments I have made for giving praise.”

contents.verseText: Then David divided the Levites into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari. 1
contents: Then David divided the Levites into divisions according to the sons of Levi:

li1: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

contents.verseText: The Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei. 1
contents: The Gershonites: Ladan

footnote.ft: Ladan is a variant of Libni; also in verses 8 and 9; see 1 Chronicles 6:17.

contents: and Shimei.

contents.verseText: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the first, Zetham, and Joel—three in all. 1
contents: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel

footnote.ft: Jehiel is a variant of Jehieli; see 1 Chronicles 26:21.

contents: the first, Zetham, and Joel—three in all.

contents.verseText: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran—three in all. These were the heads of the families of Ladan. 1
contents: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran—three in all. These were the heads of the families of Ladan.

contents.verseText: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These were the sons of Shimei—four in all.
contents: And the sons of Shimei:

footnote.ft: Shimei was possibly a son or grandson of the Shimei listed in verse 9.

contents: Jahath, Zina,

footnote.ft: Most Hebrew manuscripts; one Hebrew manuscript, LXX, and Vulgate (see also verse 11) Zizah

contents: Jeush, and Beriah. These were the sons of Shimei—four in all.

contents.verseText: Jahath was the first and Zizah was the second; but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were counted as one family and received a single assignment. 1
contents: Jahath was the first and Zizah was the second; but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were counted as one family and received a single assignment.

contents.verseText: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—four in all. 1
contents: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—four in all.

contents.verseText: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron and his descendants were set apart forever to consecrate the most holy things, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister before Him, and to pronounce blessings in His name forever.
contents: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron and his descendants were set apart forever to consecrate the most holy things, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister before Him, and to pronounce blessings in His name forever.

contents.verseText: As for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi. 1
contents: As for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.

contents.verseText: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer. 1
contents: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.

contents.verseText: The descendants of Gershom: Shebuel was the first. 1
contents: The descendants of Gershom: Shebuel was the first.

contents.verseText: The descendants of Eliezer: Rehabiah was the first. Eliezer did not have any other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous. 1
contents: The descendants of Eliezer: Rehabiah was the first. Eliezer did not have any other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.

contents.verseText: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith was the first. 1
contents: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith was the first.

contents.verseText: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth. 1
contents: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

contents.verseText: The sons of Uzziel: Micah was the first and Isshiah the second. 1
contents: The sons of Uzziel: Micah was the first and Isshiah the second.

contents.verseText: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
contents: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi.

li1: The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.

contents.verseText: Eleazar died without having any sons; he had only daughters. Their cousins, the sons of Kish, married them. 1
contents: Eleazar died without having any sons; he had only daughters. Their cousins, the sons of Kish, married them.

contents.verseText: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth—three in all.
contents: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth

footnote.ft: Jeremoth is a variant of Jerimoth; see 1 Chronicles 24:30.

contents: —three in all.

contents.verseText: These were the descendants of Levi by their families—the heads of families, registered individually by name—those twenty years of age or older who worked in the service of the house of the LORD.
contents: These were the descendants of Levi by their families—the heads of families, registered individually by name—those twenty years of age or older who worked in the service of the house of the LORD.

contents.verseText: For David had said, “The LORD, the God of Israel, has given rest to His people and has come to dwell in Jerusalem forever.
contents: For David had said, “The LORD, the God of Israel, has given rest to His people and has come to dwell in Jerusalem forever.

contents.verseText: So now the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the articles for its service.”
contents: So now the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the articles for its service.”

contents.verseText: For according to the final instructions of David, the Levites twenty years of age or older were counted,
contents: For according to the final instructions of David, the Levites twenty years of age or older were counted,

contents.verseText: but their duty was to assist the descendants of Aaron with the service of the house of the LORD, being responsible for the courts and chambers, the purification of all the holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God,
contents: but their duty was to assist the descendants of Aaron with the service of the house of the LORD, being responsible for the courts and chambers, the purification of all the holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God,

contents.verseText: as well as for the rows of the showbread, the fine flour for the grain offering, the wafers of unleavened bread, the baking, the mixing, and all measurements of quantity and size.
contents: as well as for the rows of the showbread, the fine flour for the grain offering, the wafers of unleavened bread, the baking, the mixing, and all measurements of quantity and size.

contents.verseText: They were also to stand every morning to give thanks and praise to the LORD, and likewise in the evening.
contents: They were also to stand every morning to give thanks and praise to the LORD, and likewise in the evening.

contents.verseText: Whenever burnt offerings were presented to the LORD on the Sabbaths, New Moons, and appointed feasts, they were to serve regularly before the LORD in the numbers prescribed for them.
contents: Whenever burnt offerings were presented to the LORD on the Sabbaths, New Moons, and appointed feasts, they were to serve regularly before the LORD in the numbers prescribed for them.

contents.verseText: So the Levites were to carry out the responsibilities for the Tent of Meeting and the Holy Place, and, under their brothers the descendants of Aaron, the service of the house of the LORD.
contents: So the Levites were to carry out the responsibilities for the Tent of Meeting and the Holy Place, and, under their brothers the descendants of Aaron, the service of the house of the LORD.

contents.verseText: These were the divisions of the descendants of Aaron. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
contents: These were the divisions of the descendants of Aaron. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

contents.verseText: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they had no sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
contents: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they had no sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.

contents.verseText: With the help of Eleazar’s descendant Zadok and Ithamar’s descendant Ahimelech, David divided them according to the offices of their service.
contents: With the help of Eleazar’s descendant Zadok and Ithamar’s descendant Ahimelech, David divided them according to the offices of their service.

contents.verseText: Since more leaders were found among Eleazar’s descendants than those of Ithamar, they were divided accordingly. There were sixteen heads of families from the descendants of Eleazar and eight from the descendants of Ithamar.
contents: Since more leaders were found among Eleazar’s descendants than those of Ithamar, they were divided accordingly. There were sixteen heads of families from the descendants of Eleazar and eight from the descendants of Ithamar.

contents.verseText: Thus they were divided by lot, for there were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God among both Eleazar’s and Ithamar’s descendants.
contents: Thus they were divided by lot, for there were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God among both Eleazar’s and Ithamar’s descendants.

contents.verseText: The scribe, Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded their names in the presence of the king and of the officers: Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of families of the priests and the Levites—one family being taken from Eleazar, and then one from Ithamar. 1
contents: The scribe, Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded their names in the presence of the king and of the officers: Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the heads of families of the priests and the Levites—one family being taken from Eleazar, and then one from Ithamar.

contents.verseText: The first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah, 1
contents: The first lot fell to Jehoiarib,

li1: the second to Jedaiah,

contents: the third to Harim,

li1: the sixth to Mijamin,

contents: the seventh to Hakkoz,

li1: the eighth to Abijah,

contents: the ninth to Jeshua,

li1: the tenth to Shecaniah,

contents: the eleventh to Eliashib,

li1: the twelfth to Jakim,

contents: the thirteenth to Huppah,

li1: the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,

contents: the fifteenth to Bilgah,

li1: the sixteenth to Immer,

contents: the seventeenth to Hezir,

li1: the eighteenth to Happizzez,

contents: the nineteenth to Pethahiah,

li1: the twentieth to Jehezkel,

contents: the twenty-first to Jachin,

li1: the twenty-second to Gamul,

contents: the twenty-third to Delaiah,

li1: and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.

contents.verseText: This was their appointed order for service when they entered the house of the LORD, according to the regulations prescribed for them by their forefather Aaron, as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
contents: This was their appointed order for service when they entered the house of the LORD, according to the regulations prescribed for them by their forefather Aaron, as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded him.

contents.verseText: Now these were the remaining descendants of Levi: From the sons of Amram: Shubael; from the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah. 1
contents: Now these were the remaining descendants of Levi:

li1: From the sons of Amram: Shubael;

footnote.ft: Shubael (twice in this verse) is a variant of Shebuel; see 1 Chronicles 23:16 and 1 Chronicles 26:24.

li1: from the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah.

contents.verseText: As for Rehabiah, from his sons: The first was Isshiah. 1
contents: As for Rehabiah, from his sons: The first was Isshiah.

footnote.ft: Isshiah is a variant of Jeshaiah; see 1 Chronicles 26:25.

contents.verseText: From the Izharites: Shelomoth; from the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath. 1

footnote.ft: Shelomoth (twice in this verse) is a variant of Shelomith; see 1 Chronicles 23:18.

li1: from the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.

contents.verseText: From the sons of Hebron: Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth. 1
contents: From the sons of Hebron: Jeriah was the first,

footnote.ft: Hebrew From the sons: Jeriah; see 1 Chronicles 23:19.

contents: Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

contents: The brother of Micah: Isshiah;

li1: from the sons of Isshiah: Zechariah.

li1: The son of Jaaziah: Beno.

contents: The descendants of Merari from Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.

contents: From Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.

contents: From Kish: Jerahmeel the son of Kish.

contents.verseText: And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites, according to their families.
contents: And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth.

footnote.ft: Jerimoth is a variant of Jeremoth; see 1 Chronicles 23:23.

contents: These were the sons of the Levites, according to their families.

contents.verseText: As their brothers the descendants of Aaron did, they also cast lots in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the families of the priests and Levites—the family heads and their younger brothers alike.
contents: As their brothers the descendants of Aaron did, they also cast lots in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the families of the priests and Levites—the family heads and their younger brothers alike.

contents.verseText: Additionally, David and the commanders of the army set apart some of the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun to prophesy with the accompaniment of lyres, harps, and cymbals. The following is the list of the men who performed this service: 1
contents: Additionally, David and the commanders of the army set apart some of the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun to prophesy with the accompaniment of lyres, harps, and cymbals. The following is the list of the men who performed this service:

contents.verseText: From the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah. These sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the direction of the king. 1
contents: From the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah. These sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the direction of the king.

contents.verseText: From the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah—six in all—under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the harp, giving thanks and praise to the LORD. 1
contents: From the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei,

footnote.ft: One Hebrew manuscript and some LXX manuscripts (see also verse 17); most Hebrew manuscripts do not include Shimei.

contents: Hashabiah, and Mattithiah—six in all—under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the harp, giving thanks and praise to the LORD.

contents.verseText: From the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
contents: From the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel,

footnote.ft: Shebuel is a variant of Shubael; see verse 20.

contents: Jerimoth,

footnote.ft: Jerimoth is a variant of Jeremoth; see verse 22.

contents: Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.

contents.verseText: All these sons of Heman the king’s seer were given him through the promises of God to exalt him, for God had given Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
contents: All these sons of Heman the king’s seer were given him through the promises of God to exalt him, for God had given Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

contents.verseText: All these were under the direction of their fathers for the music of the house of the LORD with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the direction of the king.
contents: All these were under the direction of their fathers for the music of the house of the LORD with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of the house of God.
Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the direction of the king.

contents.verseText: Together with their relatives, who were all trained and skillful in the songs of the LORD, they numbered 288.
contents: Together with their relatives, who were all trained and skillful in the songs of the LORD, they numbered 288.

contents.verseText: They cast lots for their duties, young and old alike, teacher as well as pupil. 1
contents: They cast lots for their duties, young and old alike, teacher as well as pupil.
